but the first big public milestone for
linkertd was joining the CNCF in January
of
2017 and then shortly after that
releasing linkery 1.0 about 3 months
four months after in April of
2017 linkerd1 was a very different beast
than today's link it ran on the JVM it
had node proxies dare I say side carless
uh but we learned an awful lot
culminating three years later in the
release of linkerd 2 this is the modern

rust go sidecars all that this is the
one that graduated about 3 years after
that from the
CNCF having reached the point that it
was basically as reliable and as stable

this is also the one three years after
that in early
2024 where we announced that we were
changing the way that we were going to
be distributing links releases some of
you all might have heard about
that i bring up these milestones mostly
because at every single stage along this
journey we got to listen to the pundits
and naysayers talking about how what we
were doing was impossible it was
completely doomed to fail it was never
going to work and reality thankfully did
not listen to them and we got to
announce in October this past October
that in fact Booant is profitable and
growing and remains committed to linking
forever as we wrote in
2021 this is a victory for simplicity in
a space that is primarily known for
complexity and it was made possible by
the fact that people like those of you
in this room had the foresight to
recognize that the whole simplicity
thing was a good idea and that walking
away from complexity by default was also
a good idea so from the bottom of our
hearts thank you very very much for
supporting
